Deficiency Narrative: Four children in care ran away from the operation in the night, staff was not aware of their absence until they returned in the morning hours.
Correction Narrative: Four children in care ran away from the operation in the night, staff was not aware of their absence until they returned in the morning hours.

Deficiency Narrative: Three children in care were to remain standing as a form of discipline after returning from runaway.
Correction Narrative: Three children in care were to remain standing as a form of discipline after returning from runaway.

Deficiency Narrative: During a review of records it was determined that EBI numbers were not reported for the first quarter.
During the investigation while reviewing records, it was found that CPR/First aid training was expired on a caregiver.
Correction Narrative: A CPR/first aid training was conducted on 5/10/2024 to ensure compliance. Moving forward the personnel files will be audited at regular intervals to ensure compliance with this standard. (uploaded current CPR & First aid training to document library)

Deficiency Narrative: During a walkthrough of the operation, it was observed that several hanging rods in the closets of the children's bedroom were loose and could be easily removed.
During the investigation it was found that a serious incident was not reported to the caregiver timely.
Correction Narrative: Please refer to inspection # 3990467 for follow up. The operation has a scheduled meeting on 3/1/24 with the staff to address these concerns and implement a new process of immediate notification despite the required time frames to ensure notifications are not delayed. The new process will consist of all notifications occurring at the time the serious incident and not waiting the required time.

Deficiency Narrative: During the course of the investigation it was determined that medication was not discontinued as needed.
Correction Narrative: Please refer to inspection #3990467. Weekly the administrator (or their designee) will check the medications for any discontinued or discarded medications and remove them when necessary.  A medication destruction form will be completed, and the medication will be returned to the pharmacy for destruction.  This is a also a condition of current probation.

Deficiency Narrative: During the course of the investigation, the victim child admitted to having access to and using the hot tub at the operation. During the walk through of the operation the hot tub was observed to be unclean and unsanitary. Staff acknowledged being aware that the child had used the hot tub. The child was diagnosed with a UTI following the incident.
Correction Narrative: A follow-up inspection was conducted. The hot tub with jets will not be used by anyone and the Administrator will remove the faucet knobs and replace with plastic inserts.

Deficiency Narrative: The post discussion with the child section is missing some elements - such as the content of the discussion, the date and time it was offered, and the date and time it took place.
Correction Narrative: On 8/21/23, George Grant contacted me and sent me proof that they emailed the correction for this on 6/29/23.  I was able to find the email in the spam folder.  This form is now in line with minimum standards and has been uploaded to digital storage.

Deficiency Narrative:
During the walkthrough, the outside patio bench was damaged, and nails were visible, and perturbing from bench. 
 Also, in one of the rooms, a chair was observed to be damaged on the seating area.
Correction Narrative: It was reported that the damaged inside furniture was thrown out, and the patio furnitiure has been fixed.

Deficiency Narrative: A child was admitted not meeting the age requirements per the license.
Correction Narrative: According to the admission/discharge documentation the child is no longer in care. Child was admitted on 4/13/2023 and discharged on 04/16/2023.

Deficiency Narrative: During the investigation it was found that the agency failed to call into the hotline a serious incident for the child in care J.M.
The toilet in bathroom 3 does not flush.
Correction Narrative: During the follow-up inspection, bathroom #3 toilet is working properly.

Deficiency Narrative: Final determination of this deficiency is pending compliance with fixing the damaged fence brought about by inclement weather.
Correction Narrative: The damaged fence, brought about by inclement weather, was accordingly fixed and repaired. Photos of the repaired fence was sent to the Inspector.

Deficiency Narrative: There is a background check listed as active however the individual is not employed at this operation, he is employed at a different location.
Correction Narrative: There is a background check listed as active however the individual is not employed at this operation, he is employed at a different location.

Deficiency Narrative: Medication records were observed to not include the reason the medication or the prescribing physician's name.
Correction Narrative: During the follow-up inspection, children records were viewed and the physican's name and reason for medication was documented.

Deficiency Narrative: A caregiver was observed to be out of ratio for at least one hour.
Correction Narrative: During the follow-up inspection observed 9 children with two staff.

Deficiency Narrative: In the child's records, there is no visible notation of the child's allergies status.
One of two employee files did not have the qualifications of the staff member.
Correction Narrative: A variance request was submitted regarding the staff member's educational background.

Deficiency Narrative: One of the restrooms had a water leakage from one of the handles in the shower.
Correction Narrative: The water leakage was stopped. The two restrooms are being completely renovated.

Deficiency Narrative: It was founded in this investigation the caregivers were not following the child's supervision requirements.
Correction Narrative:
On 07/11/2022 the inspector reached out to the administrator through e-mail for compliance plan. No response provided.

On 07/18/2022 the inspector followed up again through e-mail to the administrator for the compliance plan. No response provided.

On 07/20/2022 the inspector e-mailed the administrator to follow up on the compliance plan and reminded the administrator of potential re-citation. The licensing representative responded and stated they received the compliance plan on 07/11/2022. The compliance plan was in the inspector's spam mail.

The administrator provided a compliance plan on 07/11/2022. The action step taken in service training will be conducted regarding staff is aware of individualized supervision for each resident by 07/25/2022. This is immediately on-going.

Deficiency Narrative: Cat at operation does not have vaccines on record.
Correction Narrative: Cat at operation does not have vaccines on record.

Deficiency Narrative: First aid kits were observed missing required items such as bandages, thermometers, antiseptic solutions.
Correction Narrative: First aid kits were observed missing required items such as bandages, thermometers, antiseptic solutions..

Deficiency Narrative: Raw pork product was left to thaw in the kitchen sink. Pork product was not sealed in a leak proof bag or container.
Correction Narrative: Raw pork product was left to thaw in the kitchen sink. Pork product was not sealed in a leak proof bag or container.

Deficiency Narrative: Medication administration was not documented for the full seven days prescribed.
Correction Narrative: Medication administration was not documented for the full seven days prescribed.

Deficiency Narrative: Children in placement are being left long periods of time without supervision.
Correction Narrative: Operation emailed night supervision logs. Logs will be placed in digital storage.

Deficiency Narrative: Medication Administration Records for two residents have conflicting information regarding the reason their medication was prescribed. The medication log for two children indicated errors with the pill count on 4 separate occasions. There is one instance of the initials of the staff administering the medication not being legible.
Correction Narrative:
Medication training was provided for all employees on 1-7-22 including proper medication documentation, medication error reports and proper administering of medication. Medication audits will be conducted by facility manager and case manager to continue medication improvement. 
Medication error reports were completed and submitted with previous request for information regarding this investigation.

Deficiency Narrative: One employee does not have an active background check and is presently working for the faciity.
Correction Narrative: A review of the background checks for the operation shows that a background check was submitted for the employee identified on 1/14/2022.

Deficiency Narrative: Two out of two personnel records did not have First-aid-CPR training documented for staff.
Correction Narrative: An email from the operation was received stating that a First/Aid training was held with all staff on 1/21/22. The training log and certificates for the employees identified was also received.

Deficiency Narrative: Two out of two personnel records did not have documentation of a TB screening for the employee.
Correction Narrative: An email was received from the operation showing the employees identified have completed their TB skin tests.

Deficiency Narrative: One of two personnel records reviewed did not have documentation to show the staff meets minimum age for the position held.
Correction Narrative: An email was received from the operation stating that the employee has provided the required documentation. A copy of the documentation was also provided via email.

Deficiency Narrative: The thermometer in the refrigerator was seen to be at 48 degrees Fahrenheit and the freezer was seen to be at 3 degrees Fahrenheit .
Correction Narrative: A email was received from the operation indication that the thermometer for the freezer and refrigerator were replaced. A photograph showing the thermometer temperature within the required temperature range was provided.

Deficiency Narrative: A switch  in the one of the bathrooms was missing the switch plate covering. An outlet in the classroom area was missing a face plate.
One of three child records reviewed did not have the immunizations records.
It was found on the premises of the operation that there is an accumulation of trash and debris items located on the outer quarters behind the buildings.
The signatures of personnel administering medication were not included in the medical record.
Correction Narrative: CCR received the following from the administrator. An audit was completed by the case manager and facility manager. All signatures and initials were completed and the medication book maintained. To ensure ongoing compliance, a primary signature page for all  approved staff who administer medication was created and placed in the medical record.

Deficiency Narrative: Staff at the  operation whom have provisional background checks with conditions, are not following their conditions concerning medication administration, supervision,  and Transportation.
Correction Narrative: RCCR received the following from the LCCA: The facility manager will immediately adjust the  staff schedule and provide alternative Direct Care staff personnel to ensure adequate ratio and supervision per minimum standards

Deficiency Narrative: The operation did not provide, arrange or confirm transportation for a child in care.
Correction Narrative: The facility will verify all alternative forms of transportation for supervised and unsupervised off campus activities. All alternative forms of transportation will be verified in writing. No staff will transport a resident without first having verified with the facility manager that the child is approved for transport to and from activities. The agency will further verify transportation methods for school during the administrative and dismissal meetings. Should transportation continue to be an issue the facility manager will work with direct care staff to ensure they are informed about all bus routes, pick up and drop off times, as well as bus assignments.

Deficiency Narrative: 2 picnic tables were rotted on the legs,
Correction Narrative: RCCL Inspector Received the following. Adjustment were made to the benches

Deficiency Narrative: There was a medication log that had an error, which resulted in the count being incorrect on the medication record.
There is a hole in one of the walls located in a child's bedroom.
Correction Narrative: The hole was repaired a picture was attached.

Deficiency Narrative: There are 2 dressers that are missing knobs
Correction Narrative: RCCL Inspector received the following 2 new dressers were purchased. Attached were photos

Deficiency Narrative: Two beds did not have the protective mattress coverings.
One of the sinks in a child bedroom did not have a drain stopper with a lift handle to release the water to drain.
Correction Narrative: RCCL Inspector received the following: Sink stopper was removed, water will now follow freely down the drain. Attached was a photo.

Deficiency Narrative: The EBI policy did not list the use of short personal restraints as a type of restraint that is used at the operation.
Correction Narrative: RCCL Inspector received a copy of the updated EBI policy which included the short personal restraints.

Deficiency Narrative: During the investigation it was noticed that the medication log for a child in care did not have an accurate count of medication on the log and in the pill packet.
Correction Narrative: RCCL Inspector received the following from the Administrator:Facility manager/ Case manager will ensure to complete an audit of medication to ensure that the medication count is correct on MAR and documented properly.

Deficiency Narrative: During the investigation it was noted that a child in care's medication log did not have a signature of the person who administrated the medication.
Correction Narrative: RCCL Inspector received the following from the Administrator: All staff were notified to sign and properly document for all medication being administered to residents. Staff signatures will be verified during medication audit.

Deficiency Narrative: The diagram was missing  the designated location outside the operation. The diagram was also missing the designated area to shelter inside in case of a threatening weather.
Correction Narrative: The administrator provided RCCL inspector with a an updated diaphragm of the emergency evaluation plan. The are symbols to indicate the designated location outside the operation where caregivers and children are to meet.

Deficiency Narrative: 3 out of 4 residents reported that they have not participated in any fire evacuation drills, the operation more than several drills listed in that timeframe.
Correction Narrative: The administrator informed me that a fire and weather drill was completed with residents on 6/2/2021. The administrator will be ensuring this task is completed.

Deficiency Narrative: There was no thermometer in the first aid kit that is located inside the facility.
There were 2 over the counter medications that were expired in the first aid kit that is house in the facility.
Correction Narrative: The pills were removed during the inspection. The Administrator, Treatment director, and Facility Manager will ensure the first aid kits are maintained to compliance.

Deficiency Narrative: Five children AWOL'd from the facility and staff were not aware that the children had left.
Correction Narrative: The operation is implementing a Q60 supervision form for overnight staff. The staff will fill out the form daily and ensure residence rights to be safe and adequately supervised. The executive director will once monthly on a random basis view a live circuit of the facility to ensure compliance with supervision standards. The logs were reviewed and all logs filled out up to 1/13/2022 live circuit viewed on 1/5/2022. Residents spoken with did not express concern for their supervision and stated they are adequately supervised during all activities at the operation.

Deficiency Narrative: Caregivers failed to adhere to the child's rights to be free of abuse, neglect, and exploitation as defined in Texas Family Code 261.401
Correction Narrative: I spoke with current residents at the facility who expressed there were no staff members who have been seen sleeping while on shift. Also, the operation administrator has been conducting random checks of the overnight staff with no concerns noted in the recent past.

Deficiency Narrative: Staff member failed to demonstrate the use of appropriate de-escalation techniques, which ultimately led to a power struggle.
Correction Narrative: The follow-up information was provided after the Administrative Review occurred RCCR inspector received the following information from the Administrator: staff will be provided additional training on de-escalation techniques and managing aggression.

Deficiency Narrative: In 2 of the personnel records reviewed there was no current job description.
Correction Narrative: Written Response: The treatment director will ensure that all personnel files includes a signed job description indicated that all personnel have been informed and acknowledged of their job duties. A copy of the missing job descriptions were included with the written response.

Deficiency Narrative: There were no personnel towels or paper towels for the kids to dry their hands in one of the bathrooms.
Correction Narrative: Written Response: The Administrator and direct care staff will make sure that paper towels and toilet tissue are placed in the restrooms. .

Deficiency Narrative: There were 2 electrical outlets that are missing covers, one shower had several black stains at the bottom of the shower wall, a white baseboard needs to be repaired,  and a floor tile in one of the bathrooms needs to be repaired.
Correction Narrative: The electrical outlets were corrected during inspection. The shower has been cleaned. The base board has been repaired and the tile has been repaired. Photos of the repairs were also emailed along with the written response.

Deficiency Narrative: in 1 of 2 child records reviewed, the religious needs were no addressed. There were several other sections not addressed.
Correction Narrative: Written Response: Renewed strength will revise its bill of rights to mirror DFPS rights of youth.

Deficiency Narrative: A child was given medication that was discontinued.
Correction Narrative: Staff will be in serviced on identifying medication and matching it to a current order for medication to ensure residents are not receiving discontinued medication. This in service will be completed on 5/14/2021.

Deficiency Narrative: It was found that a caregiver was deemed Ineligible but is listed as an active employee.
Correction Narrative: The Administrator of the operation emailed the following information:  Upon separation from the agency the employee will be deactivated within a seven day period. The administrator will be responsible for the timely upkeep of the background check records and coordinating with the centralized unit.

Deficiency Narrative: It was reported that caregivers use profane language towards and in the presence of children in care.
Correction Narrative: The operation provided me the following information. On Friday 4.16.2021 a face to face training will be conducted with all personnel to address proper discipline and punishment to include not using profane language around or towards residents. I requested that a roster be provided of those that participated.

Deficiency Narrative: Children disclosed that staff use profane language in their presence.
Correction Narrative:
RCCL received an email from Mr. Garrett Grant stating the following: All staff will be in serviced on using appropriate language while in the presence of residents. All new staff will have this as part of their orientation into the agency.  Any staff found using profanity while residents are around or towards residents will be disciplined accordingly. Responsible 
Parties: George Grant, Garrett Grant, Darrian Perriatt
